body_html: @apaszke I was actually planning on doing all development in this PR, and squashing commits to make it manageable. This means we don't have to make it "public" yet (so people don't use it). And I think if I push it onto a branch, say pytorch:cpp , the CI won't test it when I make PRs (is this the case?)? Is this a good idea?

body: @apaszke I was actually planning on doing all development in this PR, and squashing commits to make it manageable. This means we don't have to make it "public"  yet (so people don't use it). And I think if I push it onto a branch, say `pytorch:cpp` , the CI won't test it when I make PRs (is this the case?)? Is this a good idea?
